qmsStandards.qmsModification: "FDA 21CFR820 Regulation-Reference NextGen QMS Process & Standards Mapping SUBPART A § 820.1, § 820.3, § 820.5 These paragraphs are addressed by the following NextGen Standards: 820.1: NextGen Quality Management System Scope defines the scope of QMS at NextGen Healthcare 820.3: Definition of terms, NextGen Quality Management System (QMS) defines standard terminology and contains a Glossary 820.5: Reference to QMS, addressed by NextGen's QMS system"

"SUBPART D: Document Controls § 820.40 Document controls. 820.40 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: NextGen's QMS system defines the company standards for creating, updating, reviewing and approving a document. This Document Control process is applicable to all NextGen employees. The process ensures that document are properly formatted, written, reviewed, stored and accessible by those who require access. SUBPART E: Purchasing controls. § 820.50 Purchasing controls. 820.50 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: NextGen utilizes a standard Procurement Process that: A. Defines the process for Vendor evaluation & setup in the procurement system. ·     This includes evaluating the vendors based on the business justification and their ability to successfully execute the contract. ·     Standard contract language and internal management reviews based on Purchase Order/contract size define management oversight and control on procured services & products. ·     A master vendor list is maintained. The Procurement process defines how this list is managed and used throughout the procurement process, including periodic maintenance & updates. SUBPART F: Identification and Traceability    § 820.60 - Identification.  820.60 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: NextGen's Configuration Management process and the Source Code Management procedure defines how the product is identified and controlled throughout the build lifecycle. After delivery to customers NextGen's installation and support organizations utilize a similar configuration management processes, the Golden Database Maintenance Procedure is used to manage & identify the various products in use by NextGen customers. Distribution logs are maintained to support periodic customer support, trouble-shooting and upgrade activity.    § 820.65 - Traceability. 820.65 is Not Applicable to NextGen. None of our software products are implantable or used in implantable devices, nor are they used in a life-sustainment role."

"SUBPART G: Production and Process Controls § 820.70 Production and process controls 820.70 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: A) NextGen's QMS systems defines the product lifecycle and includes various mechanisms for monitoring and controlling the core lifecycle processes to ensure that the product is being designed and built according to specifications. This begins in the Concept phase where product management experts, physicians and executive management define, review and approve new product ideas. Our Product Development Lifecycle Process defines how features are defined and controlled and management review and approval to proceed is obtained. Further refinement of the specification occurs next in Requirement Management activity. Multi-functional engineering, program management, QA/test, physicians, user experience and user documentation teams review the requirements produced by the business analysts. These quality management peer reviews use quality checklists and knowledge of the approved feature baseline in order to determine that the intended functionality is being properly defined and will be reflected in the end product. Similar techniques are used during subsequent design and construct phases. Finally the Verification & Validation activity is driven by the requirements' baseline and traces the evolution of features - to- requirements - to - design and then into specific test cases. This independent verification step ensures product readiness for the Beta and eventual General release of the product. 1.             Defined processes, procedures and other job aids are available throughout this lifecycle, including Requirements Management, Requirements Review & Approval, Software Architecture & Design, Program & Project Management, QA/Test, User-Centered Design and final User Documentation. 2.             The program/project managers monitor various aspects of the design/construct activity and testing run by the QA teams to monitor progress, quality & scope on the evolving products. The project team status reports, QA progress, and peer review results are gathered and used to determine how well the product production is progressing and to assess whether intervention is required. 3.             Compliance reports and requirement completion statuses are used to monitor process compliance. 4.             Processes & process support materials are defined and controlled within NextGen's QMS only after multi-functional review & approval. 5.             Product and project artifact and specification templates, examples and quality standards are defined and maintained with NextGen's QMS. b.             NextGen's Change Control Process establishes the approach for controlling changes to the product baseline features, requirements and timeline and is used throughout the production lifecycle. c.              Environmental issues are mostly not applicable to our software lifecycle; however architectural designs and constraints are produced to support verification of the system requirements for the end product. d.             Personnel: this paragraph is not applicable to NextGen. e.             Contamination Control: also n/a f.               Buildings: NextGen uses professional offices with typical Information Technology (IT) labs and test environments. 1)   & 2) NextGen’s IT labs and personal computing devices undergo regular hardware & software maintenance, upgrades & includes inspections. 3) Adjustments: n/a h.             Manufacturing Material: n/a i.               Automated processes: The Lifecycle Management system used for much of the production lifecycle is periodically tested/verified for correct operations. Software upgrade are installed & checked out using a pre-defined quality checklist in a test environment prior to release approval and issuance into full production. The QA/test team uses the same lifecycle management system mentioned previously. In addition to that the QA/Test team utilizes a software tool, integrated with the lifecycle management system, to automate the functional testing of NextGen products. This tool is also maintained in a similar manner as the lifecycle management system; upgrades are planned and test in an off-line manner so as to not interfere or risk the on-going production activity. Detailed test checklists are used to ensure proper functionality prior to release approval and issuance. § 820.72 Inspection, measuring, and test equipment 820.72 is Not Applicable to NextGen, all NextGen products, the product features and requirements are verified by testing or inspection. The validation methods defined in this section does not apply to NextGen. § 820.75 Process validation 820.75 is Not Applicable to NextGen as calibration of test and measurement equipment does not exist in our software development environment."

"SUBPART H § 820.80 - Receiving, in-process, and finished device acceptance.  820.80 is addressed by the following QMS Standards a)       NextGen's Verification and Validation process defines the activities to test, verify and validate the requirements. b)      All requirements are inspected and tested per Verification and Validation process and the evidence for the testing activities are stored in Test Case Management Tool Any defects encountered during the testing of the product are logged in Defect Management Tool per the Defects Management Procedure c)       At NextGen every product release undergoes at least 4 types of testing at various stages of the software development lifecycle, i.e., Functional Testing, Regression Testing, System Testing and UAT testing (by physicians or other SMEs and Beta Customers). Every test case defines the expected results per the defined requirements and during the test runs, testers verify that the test case meets the expected results. Per the Requirements Management Process and procedure, requirements must only be promoted to next stage if QA deems that the requirements is working as expected. Requirements are flagged completed once QA has successfully completed functional testing on those requirements. Once functional testing is completed, requirements are moved to next stage for further system testing and UAT testing. Record of each testing activities are maintained and reports are generated to satisfy product release criteria. d)      At NextGen, there are defined product release criteria that states the acceptance criteria to release the product for distribution to the client base. Before the product is released or is ready for distribution, these release criteria are reviewed and approved by the stakeholder at the Gate meeting. Gate review and approval records are maintained and is considered as release authorization. Any deviation from release criteria are also reviewed and are approved by the stakeholders."

"SUBPART I: Nonconforming product. § 820.90 - Nonconforming product. 820.90 is addressed by the following QMS Standards a)       NextGen's Verification and Validation process defines the activities to test, verify and validate the requirements. b)      All requirements are inspected and tested per Verification and Validation process and the evidence for the testing activities are stored in Test Case Management Tool Any defects encountered during the testing of the product are logged in Defect Management Tool per the Defects Management Procedure c)       At NextGen every product release undergoes at least 4 types of testing at various stages of the software development lifecycle, i.e., Functional Testing, Regression Testing, System Testing and UAT testing (by physicians or other SMEs and Beta Customers). Every test case defines the expected results per the defined requirements and during the test runs, testers verify that the test case meets the expected results. Per the Requirements Management Process and procedure, requirements must only be promoted to the next stage if the QA team deems that the requirements are working as expected. Requirements are flagged/completed once QA has successfully completed functional testing on those requirements. Once functional testing is completed, requirements are moved to next stage for further system testing and UAT testing. Record of each testing activities are maintained and reports are generated to satisfy product release criteria. d)      At NextGen, there are defined product release criteria that states the acceptance criteria to release the product for distribution to the client base. Before the product is released or is ready for distribution, these release criteria are reviewed and approved by the stakeholder at the Gate meeting. Gate review and approval record templates are defined to support documentation is captured/maintained for this release authorization. Any deviation from release criteria are also reviewed, defined for capture in the template after approval by the stakeholders."

"SUBPART J: Corrective and preventive action.    § 820.100 - Corrective and preventive action. 820.100 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: a)       Corrective and Preventive Actions are identified and managed using NextGen's Root Cause Analysis Process and Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) Process. The Root Cause Analysis Process defines the criteria and method for analyzing and identifying a root cause of any recurring defects, critical defects, regression defects, and process issues etc. RCAs are identified using 5Whys methodology. The recommendations and findings from the RCAs are maintained and are proposed for potential CAPA initiative. These CAPA initiatives are presented to management for their approval and assignment of responsibility. Once a CAPA is initiated and/ or implemented, reports are generated to measure and analyze the effectiveness of CAPA. At NextGen, CAPAs and any related documents (including reports) are maintained in the CAPA management system (i.e., SharePoint)"

"SUBPART K: Labeling and Packaging Control § 820.120 - Device labeling.  820.120 is addressed by following: NextGen's Configuration Management Tool (e.g., Perforce and Team Foundation Server), keeps the version history and assigns unique versions (i.e., label) to the software builds which helps in avoiding mix-ups during receipt and installation of our product. NextGen's Configuration Management Process defines the activities on how software is version controlled and revisions are managed. § 820.130 - Device packaging. 820.130 relates to the packaging and shipping containers; therefore 820.130 is Not Applicable for software development organization"

"SUBPART L: Handling, Storage, Distribution, and Installation § 820.140 Handling 820.180 is addressed by following: NextGen's Configuration Management Tool (e.g., Perforce and Team Foundation Server), keeps the version history and assigns unique versions to the software builds which helps in avoiding mix-ups during receipt and installation of our product. NextGen's Configuration Management Process defines the activities on how software product is version controlled and revisions are managed/controlled. § 820.150 Storage. 820.150 explains the controls during storage areas and stock rooms for product to prevent mix-ups, damage, deterioration, contamination; therefore 820.150 is Not Applicable for software development organizations. § 820.160 Distribution. At NextGen, our software products are distributed depending on the platform (i.e., desktop based application or web based). Our desktop based applications are distributed by uploading the General Release (GR) build of the product on the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) site and/ or installed by NextGen's implementation team. The web based applications (e.g., HQM, Patient Portal) are deployed on the server instances and are distributed to clients. The FTP site is controlled and maintained per the Build Distribution Procedure by Beta managers at NextGen. GR build is packaged software which is tested and passed all quality control checks before it's uploaded for client use. The builds are developed, tested and packaged per Software Development Lifecycle process. Clients can download the latest version of our product from the FTP site and our NextGen Management Agent (NMA) keeps the track of number of downloads, version downloaded and name of client download the version. § 820.170 Installation 820.170 is addressed by following: NextGen installation team performs product installation by using Installation quick guides, aka installation instruction templates specific to the product. Every installation instruction template has pre-requisites, set of actions to install and confirmation activities once the installation is completed. Completed installation instructions are stored in client relationship management tool (e.g., Salesforce). "

"SUBPART M: RECORDS § 820.180 General Requirements 820.180 is addressed by following: All records or deliverables related to QMS processes are stored in controlled documented repository per Document Control Process. The QMS Document Control process defines the standards, formats, storage (including retention policy) and management procedures for QMS procedures, process and supporting documents § 820.181 Device Master Record 820.181 is addressed by following: (a) The Device Master Records are maintained in QMS shared controlled document repository and NextGen’s Lifecycle Management System and supporting repositories, e.g. SharePoint, Perforce. (b), (c), (d) Our QMS defines the following comprehensive processes that are maintained, stored or linked from QMS website. All QMS process and procedure documents follows the Document Control Process for document preparation and approval: ·         Software Design Process, defines the process for designing, reviewing, approving the functional design specification and technical design specifications. ·         Verification and Validation Process, defines planning activities, and quality assurance procedures for product testing. ·         Configuration Management Process, defines our processes for building , packaging and versioning our software builds and/ or releases ·         Software Development Lifecycle Process, defines software development activities and procedure during our product build and maintenance ·         Installation Process , defines the installation process and procedure of our software on customer environment ·         Support Process, defines the client support procedures for client issues or complaints § 820.184 Device History Record 820.184 is addressed by the following: The Design History Records are maintained in NextGen's Lifecycle management system and supporting repositories, e.g. SharePoint, Perforce produced during the product build lifecycle. These software tools and underlying database contains a history of each product feature and the corresponding system/software requirements, design specifications and testing results. § 820.186 Quality System Record 820.186 is addressed by the following: All Quality Management deliverables including process, procedures, work instructions , project artifacts etc., are maintained in the QMS shared document repository and are controlled using the Document Control Process § 820.198 Complaint files 820.198 is addressed by the following: (a), (b) All customer complaints (aka issues), and feedback are handled by the Client Support organization, per Support Processes. All complaints and history of complaints are maintained and stored in client support system (e.g., Salesforce). Our Support Process defines the activities to be performed during issue receipt, review, evaluation, investigation and resolution. (c), (d) Any issue which has potential to cause harm to the patient, or issue which has potential to result in negative impact on customer business functions, or issue which has potential to disclose patient health information are considered to be high risk issues , aka P-Critical. All P-Critical client reported issues are handled and managed using Critical Issue Management Process. Each high risk issue is researched and clients are made aware about the issue via Newsflash Process (email notification). The Newsflash includes the issue description, i.e., version of product where the issue was encountered, product versions the issue affects; date when newsflash was released to clients; other products this issue might impact; acceptable workaround on how to perform action without encountering the same issue; and the information on where and when the issue will be fixed. Also, during the submission of high risk issues or Meaningful Use issues, clients are asked to fill detailed information within the form to analyze, evaluate the issue with quick turnaround. The form is designed per Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ) standard"

"SUBPART N: SERVICING § 820.200 Servicing 820.200 is addressed by following: a)       At NextGen, the client services or support is provided per the Support Processes. Per the support process, each client incident is maintained and managed using client support systems. The maintenance of our software is also performed per out Patch process. b)      The Global Operations team runs the weekly reports to analyze customer incidents and notify NextGen management. c)       Any issue which that has potential to cause harm to the patient, or issue which has potential to result in negative impact on customer business functions, or issue which has potential to disclose patient health information are considered to be high risk issues. All high risk client reported issues are handled and managed using Critical Issue Management Process. Each high risk issue are researched and clients are made aware about the issue via Newsflash (email notification). d)      The details and updates on the client reported issues and services are maintained in Customer Relationship Management tool (i.e., Success Community aka Salesforce) with date & time of service; product & version # of product that is being serviced; and details on when and how the issue will be fixed and delivered."

"SUBPART O: STATISTICAL TECHNIQUES § 820.250 Statistical techniques. 820.250 is addressed by following: a)       Each QMS Process document has a metrics section which describes the set of metrics used to identify the process capability and control. Compliance Reports are run at a regular cadence to identify the process deviations within each project. Also, the Global Operations team runs a set of weekly reports to understand product characteristics and trends. b)      Data analysis is done on the complete set of data as opposed to sampled data. Therefore sampling plans are not documented and are not applicable to NextGen. During product build lifecycle various performance indicators are produced by the software development teams. These indicators, based on the QMS defined build methodology, are used by management to monitor the performance and risk exposure of the product development teams. The reports generated using these data include all projects' scope, schedule, quality and overall status indicators. The process team performs trend analysis and uses process run charts to better understand overall process status and to help predict future performance and improvement needs."

cqmResults.title: Aspirin Prescribed at Discharge
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients prescribed aspirin at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Falls with Injury
cqmResults.description: This ratio measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations where at least one fall with a major or moderate injury occurs among the total qualifying inpatient hospital days for patients age 18 years and older

cqmResults.title: Assessed for Rehabilitation
cqmResults.description: Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke patients who were assessed for rehabilitation services

cqmResults.title: Severe Obstetric Complications
cqmResults.description: Patients with severe obstetric complications which occur during the inpatient delivery hospitalization.

cqmResults.title: Discharged on Antithrombotic Therapy
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients prescribed or continuing to take antithrombotic therapy at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Discharged on Statin Medication
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients who are prescribed or continuing to take statin medication at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Excessive Radiation Dose or Inadequate Image Quality for Diagnostic Computed Tomography (CT) in Adults (Clinician Level)
cqmResults.description: This measure provides a standardized method for monitoring the performance of diagnostic CT to discourage unnecessarily high radiation doses, a risk factor for cancer, while preserving image quality. It is expressed as a percentage of patients with CT exams that are out-of-range based on having either excessive radiation dose or inadequate image quality relative to evidence-based thresholds based on the clinical indication for the exam. All diagnostic CT exams of specified anatomic sites performed in inpatient, outpatient and ambulatory care settings are eligible. This measure is not telehealth eligible. This eCQM requires the use of additional software to access primary data elements stored within radiology electronic health records and translate them into data elements that can be ingested by this eCQM. Additional details are included in the Guidance field.

cqmResults.title: Stroke Education
cqmResults.description: Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke patients or their caregivers who were given educational materials during the hospital stay addressing all of the following: activation of emergency medical system, need for follow-up after discharge, medications prescribed at discharge, risk factors for stroke, and warning signs and symptoms of stroke

cqmResults.title: Excessive Radiation Dose or Inadequate Image Quality for Diagnostic Computed Tomography (CT) in Adults (Facility IQR)
cqmResults.description: This measure provides a standardized method for monitoring the performance of diagnostic CT to discourage unnecessarily high radiation doses, a risk factor for cancer, while preserving image quality. This measure is expressed as a percentage of CT exams that are out-of-range based on having either excessive radiation dose or inadequate image quality relative to evidence-based thresholds based on the clinical indication for the exam. All diagnostic CT exams of specified anatomic sites performed in hospital inpatient care settings are eligible. This eCQM requires the use of additional software to access primary data elements stored within radiology electronic health records and translate them into data elements that can be ingested by this eCQM. Additional details are included in the Guidance field.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Prophylaxis
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients who received VTE prophylaxis or have documentation why no VTE prophylaxis was given the day of or the day after hospital admission or surgery end date for surgeries that start the day of or the day after hospital admission

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Patients Receiving Unfractionated Heparin with Dosages/Platelet Count Monitoring by Protocol or Nomogram
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE who received intravenous (IV) UFH therapy dosages AND had their platelet counts monitored using defined parameters such as a nomogram or protocol.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Discharge Instructions
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE that are discharged to home, home care, court/law enforcement or home on hospice care on warfarin with written discharge instructions that address all four criteria: compliance issues, dietary advice, follow-up monitoring, and information about the potential for adverse drug reactions/ interactions.

cqmResults.title: Median Admit Decision Time to ED Departure Time for Admitted Patients
cqmResults.description: Median time (in minutes) from admit decision time to time of departure from the emergency department for emergency department patients admitted to inpatient status.

cqmResults.title: Elective Delivery
cqmResults.description: Patients with elective vaginal deliveries or elective cesarean births at >= 37 and < 39 weeks of gestation completed

cqmResults.title: Incidence of Potentially-Preventable Venous Thromboembolism
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE during hospitalization (not present at admission) who did not receive VTE prophylaxis between hospital admission and the day before the VTE diagnostic testing order date.

cqmResults.title: HIV Annual Retention in Care
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, with a diagnosis of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) during the first 240 days of the measurement period or before the measurement period who had at least two eligible encounters or at least one eligible encounter and one HIV viral load test that were at least 90 days apart within the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Childhood Immunization Status
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children 2 years of age who had four diphtheria, tetanus and acellular pertussis (DTaP); three polio (IPV), one measles, mumps and rubella (MMR); three H influenza type B (HiB); three hepatitis B (Hep B); one chicken pox (VZV); four pneumococcal conjugate (PCV); one hepatitis A (Hep A); two or three rotavirus (RV); and two influenza (flu) vaccines by their second birthday.

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate
Clinical Quality Measures - Report

cqmResults.title: Sexually Transmitted Infection (STI) Testing for People with HIV
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 13 years of age and older with a diagnosis of HIV who had tests for syphilis, gonorrhea, and chlamydia performed within the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Excessive Radiation Dose or Inadequate Image Quality for Diagnostic Computed Tomography (CT) in Adults (Facility OQR)
cqmResults.description: This measure is an episode of care measure that provides a standardized method for monitoring the performance of diagnostic CT to discourage unnecessarily high radiation doses, a risk factor for cancer, while preserving image quality. This measure is expressed as a percentage of CT exams that are out-of-range based on having either excessive radiation dose or inadequate image quality relative to evidence-based thresholds based on the clinical indication for the exam. All diagnostic CT exams of specified anatomic sites performed in hospital non-inpatient care settings (including emergency settings) are eligible. This eCQM requires the use of additional software to access primary data elements stored within radiology electronic health records and translate them into data elements that can be ingested by this eCQM. Additional details are included in the Guidance field.

cqmResults.description: Average percentage of time in which patients aged 18 and older with atrial fibrillation who are on chronic warfarin therapy have International Normalized Ratio (INR) test results within the therapeutic range (i.e., TTR) during the measurement period.

cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older who were diagnosed with acute myocardial infarction (AMI), coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) or percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI) in the 12 months prior to the measurement period, or who had a diagnosis of ischemic vascular disease (IVD) during the measurement period, and who had a complete lipid profile performed during the measurement period and whose most recent Low-density Lipoprotein (LDL-C) was adequately controlled (< 100 mg/dL).

cqmResults.title: Healthy Term Newborn
cqmResults.description: Percent of term singleton live births (excluding those with diagnoses originating in the fetal period) who DO NOT have significant complications during birth or the nursery care

cqmResults.title: Initial Antibiotic Selection for Community-Acquired Pneumonia (CAP) in Immunocompetent Patients
cqmResults.description: (PN-6) Immunocompetent patients with Community-Acquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines. (Population 1) Immunocompetent ICU patients with Community-Acquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines. (Population 2) Immunocompetent non-Intensive Care Unit (ICU) patients with Community-Acquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines

cqmResults.title: Intensive Care Unit Venous Thromboembolism Prophylaxis
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients who received VTE prophylaxis or have documentation why no VTE prophylaxis was given the day of or the day after the initial admission (or transfer) to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) or surgery end date for surgeries that start the day of or the day after ICU admission (or transfer)

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Screening for Depression and Follow-Up Plan
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 12 years and older screened for depression on the date of the encounter using an age appropriate standardized depression screening tool AND if positive, a follow-up plan is documented on the date of the positive screen.

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Screening for High Blood Pressure and Follow-Up Documented
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older seen during the reporting period who were screened for high blood pressure AND a recommended follow-up plan is documented based on the current blood pressure (BP) reading as indicated

cqmResults.title: Appropriate Use of DXA Scans in Women Under 65 Years Who Do Not Meet the Risk Factor Profile for Osteoporotic Fracture
cqmResults.description: Percentage of female patients 50 to 64 years of age without select risk factors for osteoporotic fracture who received an order for a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) scan during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: Home Management Plan of Care (HMPC) Document Given to Patient/Caregiver
cqmResults.description: An assessment that there is documentation in the medical record that a Home Management Plan of Care (HMPC) document was given to the pediatric asthma patient/caregiver

cqmResults.title: Statin Prescribed at Discharge
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients who are prescribed a statin medication at hospital discharge.

cqmResults.title: Hearing Screening Prior To Hospital Discharge
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the proportion of births that have been screened for hearing loss before hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: HIV Viral Suppression
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, diagnosed with HIV prior to or during the first 90 days of the measurement period, with an eligible encounter in the first 240 days of the measurement period, whose last HIV viral load test result was less than 200 copies/mL during the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Median Time from ED Arrival to ED Departure for Discharged ED Patients
cqmResults.description: Median elapsed time from emergency department arrival to emergency room departure for patients discharged from the emergency department

cqmResults.title: Cesarean Birth
cqmResults.description: Nulliparous women with a term, singleton baby in a vertex position delivered by cesarean birth

cqmResults.title: Statin Therapy for the Prevention and Treatment of Cardiovascular Disease
cqmResults.description: Percentage of the following patients - all considered at high risk of cardiovascular events - who were prescribed or were on statin therapy during the measurement period: Adults aged >= 21 years who were previously diagnosed with or currently have an active diagnosis of clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD); OR Adults aged >= 21 years who have ever had a fasting or direct low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) level >= 190 mg/dL or were previously diagnosed with or currently have an active diagnosis of familial or pure hypercholesterolemia; OR Adults aged 40-75 years with a diagnosis of diabetes with a fasting or direct LDL-C level of 70-189 mg/dL

cqmResults.description: Proportion of inpatient hospitalizations for patients 18 years of age and older prescribed, or continued on, two or more opioids or an opioid and benxodiazepine concurrently at discharge

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: Pneumocystis Jiroveci Pneumonia (PCP) Prophylaxis

cqmResults.title: Core Clinical Data Elements for the Hybrid Hospital-Wide Readmission (HWR) Measure with Claims and Electronic Health Record Data
cqmResults.description: This logic is intended to extract electronic clinical data. This is not an electronic clinical quality measure and this logic will not produce measure results. Instead, it will produce a file containing the data that CMS will link with administrative claims to risk adjust the Hybrid HWR outcome measure. It is designed to extract the first resulted set of vital signs and basic laboratory results obtained from encounters for adult Medicare Fee-For-Service patients admitted to acute care short stay hospitals.

cqmResults.title: Primary PCI Received Within 90 Minutes of Hospital Arrival
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients with ST-segment elevation on the ECG closest to arrival time receiving primary PCI during the hospital stay with a time from hospital arrival to PCI of 90 minutes or less

cqmResults.title: Median Time from ED Arrival to ED Departure for Admitted ED Patients
cqmResults.description: Median time from emergency department arrival to time of departure from the emergency room for patients admitted to the facility from the emergency department

cqmResults.title: Functional Status Assessment for Total Hip Replacement
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with primary total hip arthroplasty (THA) who completed baseline and follow-up patient-reported functional status assessments.

cqmResults.title: Fibrinolytic Therapy Received Within 30 Minutes of Hospital Arrival
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients with ST-segment elevation on the ECG closest to arrival time receiving fibrinolytic therapy during the hospital stay and having a time from hospital arrival to fibrinolysis of 30 minutes or less.

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Cholesterol - Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL-C) Test Performed
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 20 through 79 years whose risk factors have been assessed and a fasting LDL-C test has been performed.

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: Medical Visit
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, with a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS with at least two medical visits during the measurement year with a minimum of 90 days between each visit

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Risk-Stratified Cholesterol -Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL-C)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 20 through 79 years who had a fasting LDL-C test performed and whose risk stratified fasting LDL-C is at or below the recommended LDL-C goal.

cqmResults.title: Bone density evaluation for patients with prostate cancer and receiving androgen deprivation therapy
cqmResults.description: Patients determined as having prostate cancer who are currently starting or undergoing androgen deprivation therapy (ADT), for an anticipated period of 12 months or greater and who receive an initial bone density evaluation. The bone density evaluation must be prior to the start of ADT or within 3 months of the start of ADT.

cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18-85 years of age with a diagnosis of hypertension whose blood pressure improved during the measurement period.

cqmResults.description: Percentage of visits for patients aged 18 years and older for which the eligible professional attests to documenting a list of current medications using all immediate resources available on the date of the encounter. This list must include ALL known prescriptions, over-the-counters, herbals, and vitamin/mineral/dietary (nutritional) supplements AND  must contain the medications' name, dosage, frequency and route of administration.

cqmResults.title: Anticoagulation Therapy for Atrial Fibrillation/Flutter
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients with atrial fibrillation/flutter who are prescribed or continuing to take anticoagulation therapy at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Antithrombotic Therapy By End of Hospital Day 2
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients administered antithrombotic therapy by the end of hospital day 2

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Patients with Anticoagulation Overlap Therapy
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE who received an overlap of parenteral (intravenous [IV] or subcutaneous [subcu]) anticoagulation and warfarin therapy. For patients who received less than five days of overlap therapy, they should be discharged on both medications or have a reason for discontinuation of overlap therapy. Overlap therapy should be administered for at least five days with an international normalized ratio (INR) greater than or equal to 2 prior to discontinuation of the parenteral anticoagulation therapy, discharged on both medications or have a reason for discontinuation of overlap therapy

cqmResults.title: Primary Caries Prevention Intervention as Offered by Primary Care Providers, including Dentists
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children, age 0-20 years, who received a fluoride varnish application during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: RNA control for Patients with HIV
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 13 years and older with a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS, with at least two visits during the measurement year, with at least 90 days between each visit, whose most recent HIV RNA level is <200 copies/mL.

cqmResults.title: International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) or American Urological Association-Symptom Index (AUA-SI) Change 6-12 Months After Diagnosis of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients with an office visit within the measurement period and with a new diagnosis of clinically significant Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia who have International Prostate Symptoms Score (IPSS) or American Urological Association (AUA) Symptom Index (SI) documented at time of diagnosis and again 6-12 months later with an improvement of 3 points

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Severe Hypoglycemia
cqmResults.description: Inpatient hospitalizations for patients 18 years of age or older at admission, who were administered at least one hypoglycemic medication during the encounter, who suffer the harm of a severe hypoglycemic event during the encounter

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Opioid-Related Adverse Events
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations for patients age 18 and older who have been administered an opioid medication and are subsequently administered an opioid antagonist within 12 hours, an indication of an opioid-related adverse event

cqmResults.title: Maternal Depression Screening
cqmResults.description: The percentage of children who turned 6 months of age during the measurement year, who had a face-to-face visit between the clinician and the child during child's first 6 months, and who had a maternal depression screening for the mother at least once between 0 and 6 months of life

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Pressure Injury
cqmResults.description: The measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations for patients aged 18 and older who suffer the harm of developing a new stage 2, stage 3, stage 4, deep tissue, or unstageable pressure injury

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Acute Kidney Injury
cqmResults.description: The measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations for patients age 18 and older who have an acute kidney injury (stage 2 or greater) that occurred during the encounter. Acute kidney injury (AKI) stage 2 or greater is defined as a substantial increase in serum creatinine value, or by the initiation of kidney dialysis (continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT), hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis).

cqmResults.title: Core Clinical Data Elements for the Hybrid Hospital-Wide (All-Condition, All-Procedure) Risk-Standardized Mortality Measure (HWM)
cqmResults.description: This logic is intended to extract electronic clinical data. This is not an electronic clinical quality measure and this logic will not produce measure results. Instead, it will produce a file containing the data that CMS will link with administrative claims to risk adjust the Hybrid HWM outcome measure. It is designed to extract the first resulted set of vital signs and basic laboratory results obtained from encounters for adult Medicare Fee-For-Service patients admitted to acute care short stay hospitals.

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Severe Hyperglycemia
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of inpatient hospital days with a hyperglycemic event (harm) per the total qualifying inpatient hospital days for that encounter for patients 18 years of age or older at admission

cqmResults.title: Exclusive Breast Milk Feeding
cqmResults.description: Exclusive breast milk feeding during the newborn's entire hospitalization

cqmResults.title: Functional Status Assessment for Congestive Heart Failure
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 65 years and older with congestive heart failure who completed initial and follow-up patient-reported functional status assessments

cqmResults.title: Thrombolytic Therapy
cqmResults.description: Acute ischemic stroke patients who arrive at this hospital within 2 hours of time last known well and for whom t-PA was initiated at this hospital within 3 hours of time last known well.

cqmResults.title: Kidney Health Evaluation
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18-75 years with a diagnosis of diabetes who received a kidney health evaluation defined by an Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) AND Urine Albumin-Creatinine Ratio (uACR) within the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Global Malnutrition Composite Score
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the percentage of hospitalizations for adults aged 65 years and older at the start of the inpatient encounter during the measurement period with a length of stay equal to or greater than 24 hours who received optimal malnutrition care during the current inpatient hospitalization where care performed was appropriate to the patient's level of malnutrition risk and severity. Malnutrition care best practices recommend that for each hospitalization, adult inpatients are screened for malnutrition risk, assessed to confirm findings of malnutrition risk or for a hospital dietitian referral order, and if identified with a "moderate" or "severe" malnutrition status in the current performed malnutrition assessment, receive a current "moderate" or "severe" malnutrition diagnosis and have a current nutrition care plan performed.

cqmResults.title: Appropriate Treatment for ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) Patients in the Emergency Department (ED)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of emergency department (ED) encounters for patients 18 years and older with a diagnosis of ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) that received appropriate treatment, defined as fibrinolytic therapy within 30 minutes of ED arrival, percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) within 90 minutes of ED arrival, or transfer within 45 minutes of ED arrival
